result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael B Koepp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC AMENDED FROM Felony Possession of THC (2nd/subsequent dismissed), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: CORRECTED 04-14-2016:  Length of probation corrected to one year.

miscConds.notes: If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Attend five self-help meetings per week.  Provide verification of attendance to agent.  Expungment granted if probation successfully completed with no violations, which includes attending the five self-help meetings weekly.

charges.descr: Possession of THC   AMENDED FROM Felony Possession of THC (2nd/subsequent dismissed)

From DOC re: requesting JOC be corrected/amended.
Undecided about seeking post conviction relief

Defendant Michael B Koepp in court with attorney Daniel P Fay.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
Plea questionnaire filed.
State's offer:  Plea to count 1 as amended to misd possession of THC and count 2 PDP without repeater enhancer

State will recommend 1 yr probation
PLEA-guilty each of 2 counts
Parties stipulate to Court using criminal complaint as factual basis.
Court finds plea entered freely, knowingly and voluntarily.
BTC: finding of guilt, judgment of conviction on each
Defense requesting $250 fine each count plus costs and surcharges.  Expungment also requested.  Defendant currently on probation in Waukesha County with the possibility of expungment.
Defendant currently in treatment and doing well.  
Defendant makes statement on own behalf.
BTC: probation  1 yr each ct cc
no alcohol, controlled substances
costs, surcharges
5 self-help mtgs weekly
signed proof to agent weekly
Expungment granted if probation successfully completed with no violations.  This includes attending the 5 meetings per week.
from Oakton Avenue Law Offices re: sentencing recommendation.

Defendant Michael B Koepp in court with attorney Daniel P Fay.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
Resolution reached; plea date requested.
Plea hearing on April 4, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
from Atty Fay, re: Stip and Order enclosures. (signed copies already on file--Signed copies forwarded to Atty Fay)
From Atty Fay re: enclosure of ddid

Defendant Michael B Koepp in court with attorney Daniel P Fay.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Michael B Koepp in court with attorney Keith David O'Donnell.  Defendant Michael B Koepp in custody.  W. Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
